result.execSummary:
The defendant Shakyla R Shannon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim D.S (person, property, residence or family). Make all court appearances on time. Defendant to be placed on house arrest with GPS monitoring by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403) by 4:00 pm on the day of your court appearance.  Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments, school, and employment with Chucky Cheese. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
**2-1-22 MODIFY CONDITIONS OF BOND TO ALLOW DEFT TO ATTEND EXTRA SCHOOL ACTIVITIES WHILE ON GPS.**
**2-28-22 MODIFY CONDITIONS OF BOND TO REMOVE GPS MONITORING.**
